alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County; White Mountains of Inyo County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 17 at 2:01PM PDT until March 22 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet between 7000 and 9000 feet and 2 to 4 feet above 9000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Sierra Slopes and White Mountains of Inyo County. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Heavy snow accumulations could cause tree or power pole damage, resulting in power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will start out 5000 to 6000 feet on Monday, dropping to 4000 to 5000 feet on Tuesday and dropping to 3000 to 4000 feet on Wednesday. Highest precipitation rates will occur on Tuesday.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County; White Mountains of Inyo County
